intro: Galium angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Galium angustifolium typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
